bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, July 6, 1907

div1.p: Ida Kissinger profusely thanks Kelly for the latest check and claims that his continued friendship is more important than the money.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, July 6, 1907
div1.opener:
Copy to Dr Kelly
John R Kissinger
606 E Keasey St
South Bend
Ind.
July /07
Dr Howard A. Kelly
div1.p:
Dear Sir and kind friend yours
received this a.m and words canot tell
how Happy It makes us to receive the
amount you sent us we have worked so
hard to keep things up.

Mr Kissinger cried like a child when I
handed Him the check we certainly thank
you and wish you to thank other kind friend,
for us that has taken the Intrest in
us this morning not so much before
The mail man called I was looking at
your Picture which we keep. on our sitting
Room table' and I wondered why
we had not heard from you not
for money sake but for friendship
sake because we both fell that you
have been a good kind friend to us
my circumstances have not always been
quite so poor but my Parents are both dead
and have only stranger and acquaintances
for friends and advisers the Lord
is my best friend I can go to him
when all others fail oh what a
comfort. It is Mr. Kissinger health dosnt
improve any kinds friend Jennie Wilson
who is an invalid at South Whittly and
through other friend have sent Mr Kissinger
a wheel chair self Propeling it hasent come
yet but he watches for it anxiously the one
he has I had to Push by the back wishing to
thank you again we will remain your true
friends and well wishers

closer.signed: Mr. and Mrs. John R Kissinger
